dialogues.speaker: DOWN THE HALL
dialogues.text: DOUG stopped at the RUNWAY, staring into THE ARENA. Thirt thousand empty seats. DOUG swallows. The enormity of the situation dawning on him as he looks out onto the ice he’ be skating on. He turns to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE, as mad as we’ve ever seen her, storming back up the hall toward him.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: What’s going on? (no answer) Kate, what’s the matter?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: They won’t let us skate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JACK and SIX NEW YORK LAWYERS are seated across from THUM TUTTLE, and SEVERAL USFSA OFFICIALS. The mood is tense.

dialogues.speaker: THUMAN
dialogues.text: ..-Rick’s raised some serious v4 allegations about Dorsey’s amateur status. I know you’ve flown your people down, Jack, but I’m doubtful we can clarify this in the next ten hours. ‘ The HEAD LAWYER is about speak, when JACK waves him off -

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: There isn’t a skater. in this hotel who doesn’t have a blind trust, club sponsor, or --

dialogues.speaker: TUTTLE
dialogues.text: -- That’s absurd!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Since Mr. Tuttle seems incredulous, I think we owe him the courtesy of enlightenment, and to make it easy, I suggest we start by exploring the unique "scholarship" arrangement his skaters receive at the University where he so nobly acts as a tenured professor of... (drawing a blank) What is it exactly, Rick that you’re a professor of?

dialogues.speaker: TUTTLE
dialogues.text: This is outrageous!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: My feelings exactly.

dialogues.speaker: THUMAN
dialogues.text: -- Gentlemen, please!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let’s cut to the cherry, Gerald. You cheat my kids out of their chance to skate and I’1l bury your butts so deep in legal compost it’1ll take a fucking millenium to dig your way out. Is that clear enough?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No crowd. On the ice, FOUR PAIRS, in warm ups, practicing COACHES, JUDGES, and OTHER SKATERS clustered in groups. . TUTTLE is huddled with his two skaters: BRIAN NEWMAN, Kat old partner, and LORIE PAULSEN, young, dark, and very cut

dialogues.speaker: ANTON, (OVER)
dialogues.text: Ice is good? TUTTLE stiffens, turns, his eyes narrowing on -- ANTON smiling, as KATE and DOUG pass through the runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Practice. KATE AND DOUG on the ice. She’s leading him slowly. SKATERS all around them. DOUG looks tentative.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Nervous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? -- Are you kidding? A PAIR skates past -- DOUG, having trouble seeing, picks them up almost too late. KATE pulls him back.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Don’t worry, it’s a head game. TWO.SKATERS COME SPEEDING PAST -- DOUG flinches.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Yumez and Weaver. They cry on command. ANOTHER PAIR -- TWINS -~- almost identical, come twirling by; huge idiotic smiles plastered across their faces.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: The Weiderman twins. Don’t get too close, you’ll go into sugar shock. A THIRD PAIR stops with a flourish nearby.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Spindler and Nyman. He’s good, but she has one more doughnut and he’1ll never get her off the ice. SPINDLER, the male partner, looks over.

dialogues.speaker: SPINDLER
dialogues.text: (very gay) Well, Kate, surprise surprise...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Hello, Gary.

dialogues.speaker: SPINDLER
dialogues.text: (eyeing Doug) No wonder you’ve been keeping him to yourself. DOUG stares, very uncomfortable. SPINDLER winks before NYMAN, his hefty female partner pulls him away.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You’1l get used to it. DOUG looks unsure. They pick up the pace a little, still just getting loose. DOUG’s eye drawn away toward -- BRIAN AND LORIE PAULSEN on the ice, nearby. BRIAN lifting her and out into a finishing move. , :

dialogues.speaker: DOUG, (QVER)
dialogues.text: Who’s that? KATE bristles, nudging him away.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Brian Newman, my old partner.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (still looking) And Paulsen, right? -- Lorie Paulsen. KATE looks at him, surprised. DOUG smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hey, just trying to keep up. CUT To: INT. MEN’S LOCKER ROOM A tight space. A DOZEN MALE SKATERS changing, showering. SPINDLER and BRIAN in the midst of a catty conversation:  © “1 a

dialogues.speaker: SPINDLER
dialogues.text: I said, honey, if you think this is a workout, you’ve got’a lot to learn.

dialogues.speaker: BRIAN
dialogues.text: He can be such a Queen. DOUG, stripped to his underwear, stands nearby listening, tearing through his locker as fast as he can.

dialogues.speaker: SPINDLER
dialogues.text: Give me a set of eyelashes like that and I’d get away with murder too. DOUG, in his haste, pulls too hard and the contents of h: locker come suddenly spilling out onto the floor. BRIAN and SPINDLER turn. DOUG, looking very uncomfortable grabs his jeans, and then stands to see them both eyeing

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: What? (Spindler and Brian exchange a coy glance) What’re you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: . SPINDLER
dialogues.text: Relax, honey. No one’s gonna steal your socks. DOUG, undone, turns away, yanking on his jeans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANTON seated, making notes, looks up to see DOUG rushing

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Douglas! (Doug stops, Anton walks over) Katya is ready?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I’m going ahead.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (sensing trouble) Something is wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Look, I’1l see you back at the hotel, okay?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Competition is so frightening?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ue

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s not the skating. (Anton waits) Look, man, I’ve got a reputation to preserve. I’ve gotta live with myself. (he shakes his head) I should’ve known this was gonna be the story.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: What story? What is problem?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I’ve been in a lot of locker rooms in my life and I’ve never, I mean, never, seen anything like that. (a beat) Half those guys are wearing make-up for chissake! ANTON stares. The message coming through loud and clear.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Is this a problem?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Is.this a problem? You think I want everyone going around saying I’m some kind of faggot? DOUG is angry. ANTON’s eyes narrow.

dialogues.speaker: _ DOUG
dialogues.text: I should’ve known this would happen! You should’ve known. Christ, you’ve been in this racket for years, how the hell can you stand it?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Is simple. I am faggot. DOUG stares, ashen. ANTON’s expression unyielding.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Is true. Anton is homosexual.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: «--but your daughter?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: She is not gay.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: That’s not what I mean! And what about Judy? Judy who’s calling all the time?

dialogues.speaker: . ANTON
dialogues.text: A friend. Her brother and I were once lovers.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: C’mon -=- You were married! You had kids! -- (backing away) Oh man...we’ve been sharing that house for over a year! You...you should’ve told me -- I had every right to know!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Why? You are gay too?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Then where is problem?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You could be trying to convert me!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Are you trying to be sleeping with with every woman you meet? (a beat) . Is bad question. Not everyone is so hungry. DOUG stands there, rocked. ANTON’s expression darkens.
I’m sorry for disappointment. We catch up later. You will excuse me. ANTON turns sharply and strides away.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DOUG’S HOTEL ROOM -- DAY DOUG, alone in bed, staring at the ceiling. Fitful, thinking. Finally, he stands. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: " poUG heading away from his room, rounding a corner to - AN ELEVATOR BANK -- LORIE PAULSEN standing there. She loo ever. Just the two of them. She smiles. Very friendly.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: Going down?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You talked me into it. (he pauses) so, what'd you think of the ice?

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: Cold, flat and hard -- just like always. She smiles, watching him. DOUG a little off stride, as th EMPTY ELEVATOR opens. He holds the door.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: (as she steps in) Just making small talk, or are you one of these monomaniacal skate-junkies? She’s got his attention. DOUG shakes his head, following her into the ELEVATOR as the DOOR CLOSES

dialogues.speaker: THE ELEVATOR DOOR
dialogues.text: Opening. Inside, DOUG and LORIE laughing so hard they fai to notice they’ve arrived at the lobby. DOUG looks up -- KATE AND HALE standing there. KATE venomously notes the scene. LORIE slips past, flashing a smile at KATE.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: (to Doug) See you around,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. LORIE disappears into the lobby. HALE holds the door.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (icily) I thought you were napping.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I couldn’t sleep.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Anton went for the draw.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I/11 wait down here. HALE ushers KATE onto the elevator. She glares at DOUG as the DOORS CLOSE’. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INT. KATE’S HOTEL ROOM -= DAY KATE tearing furiously around the room. HALE watching.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Flirting around with that little slut! My God, he has the self control of a rabbit!

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Kate, c’mon, it’s no big deal.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: ? Have you lost your mind? {Hale winces) God knows what he’s telling that little little tramp! HALE comes closer, begins massaging her shoulders. KATE s tensed-up that his overture doesn’t register at first.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I bet Brian put her up to it! HALE works his arms around her more amorously.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He’s an animal! Two minutes with that tart and he’s in heat! (noting Hale’s advances) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Taking your mind off it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (pulling away) 2
Kate --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (wildly) -- He’s supposed to be in his room! He’s supposed to be sleeping! --

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: -> Kate --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (right over him) -- He’s supposed to be alone and resting and instead he’s downstairs, or God knows where, groping around with the biggest slut on the circuit! 73

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You’re nuts!

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: -- Kate! (she stops) It’s a hotel for crying out loud! They were two people getting off an elevator! It’s hardly what I’d call a crisis. She’s gone too far. And she knows it. HALE stares at her, looking for something and not finding it.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: This doesn’t have anything to do with skating, does it?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: You’re falling for him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: You are. (as if it just hit him) You’re falling for him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: That’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far has it gone?

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Am I? -~ How far has it gone?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You see how we act together.

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: I ‘sure do.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: We’ve never gotten along! We’re always fighting!

dialogues.speaker: HALE
dialogues.text: Foreplay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DoUG sitting reading a newspaper. He looks up to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ) HALE huffing through the lobby, carrying his suitcase. This is aman in a hurry. He’s leaving. For good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A limousine parked out front.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE LIMO
dialogues.text: ANTON and DOUG waiting in silence. Tense silence, until:

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Apologizing is like one of the worst things I do. I guess I never really picked it up. ANTON turns. DOUG, tight, hesitates. DOUG . What happened before...back at the dome...I wanted to tell you I was sorry. I made an ass of myself. ANTON . e@ As apologies go, that was acceptable.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG '
dialogues.text: I don’t want to get too good at it.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Life is not so simple, eh? pDoUG I guess not. A pause -- the moment broken as the DOOR OPENS and KATE barrels into the car. ANTON and DOUG stare at her, lookin for signs of breakage.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (definitively) I don’t want to talk about it. THE LIMO pulls out. KATE, sensing ANTON’s eyes still on her, wheels around, notes his concerned expression --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You want to worry about something? Worry about Ramjet the Rookie here! Nt ANTON glances over at DOUG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bi

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You are okay?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Fine. No problem. Never better. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The parking lot jammed. Crowds pouring into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO ANNOUNCERS -- JOJO and. SCOTT -- talking to the CAMER

dialogues.speaker: JOJO
dialogues.text: So here we are, Scott, night number four of the Nationals, the start of the Pairs Competition. scoTrT The country’s twelve best couples are in the building tonight and... (continuing as we--)

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. MEN’S LOCKER ROOM ~-- SAME TIME SKATERS suiting up silently. DOUG off in the corner as --

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (QVER)
dialogues.text: «..only two of these couples are going to make the U.S. National Team and go on to the Olympics.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. _ LADIES’ LOCKER ROOM -- SAME TIME And if you thought the men’s dressing room was tense...

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (QVER)
dialogues.text: Tonight we’re seeing the short program, that is, the two and a half minute routine of required moves... KATE at the mirror, eyes wandering in the reflection TO F ~- LORIE PAULSEN at a mirror across the room smiling back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: These skaters have drawn for position and the pairs with the highest scores after tonight will be seeded for tomorrow night’s long progran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: a2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place packed. MUSIC PLAYING -- RACHMANINOFF -- as ONE OF THE TWELVE PAIRS skate their short program. Just a moment of this -- they turn, and a Camel sit spin and -

dialogues.speaker: WIPE TO
dialogues.text: A GLENN MILLER CLASSIC -- ANOTHER PAIR -- into a lift and turn and they falter and SHE falls and --

dialogues.speaker: WIPE TO
dialogues.text: A SOUSA MARCH PLAYING -- SPINDLER and NYMAN skating -- no bad, but he’s struggling a little to lift her and --

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RUNWAY
dialogues.text: KATE and DOUG dressed in simple, elegant, flattering cost They’re on next. DOUG stands very stiffly. His eyes look unfocused. KATE watches him.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You look nervous. (no response) You look really ‘nervous. DOUG, stone~faced, says nothing. KATE moves closer.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: How nervous are you? (Doug can’t talk)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A moment, and then suddenly -- DOUG dashes off -- sprinti several yards down the runway -- he stops -- leans under scaffolding of bleachers getting sick, as the SOUSA MARCH crashes to it’s rousing conclusion and the CROWD CHEERS. KATE is aghast. She looks around. SEVERAL SKATING MONITOR are staring at’ DOUG as he walks back gingerly.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What _is wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (weakly) I always get tight before a game. KATE stares.at him. He’s hyperventilating.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Let’s put it this way, when I played hockey I used to have two helmets, the one I’d use during the game and the one I’d use before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why_hasn’t this come up before?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Bad choice of words. In the BG, SPINDLER AND NYMAN come flying off the ice.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (incredulous) . I don’t believe this! (Doug cringes as--) "Oh, I’m fine." "Never better." "No problem." “Don’t sweat it." DOUG looks woozy again. KATE is desperate. MORE PEOPLE standing around begin to take notice. She grabs hin.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Look at me! Look in my eyes. (she slaps him) Smile! DOUG tries a shaky smile. KATE grabs his ear, practically pulling it off -- DOUG howls --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Concentrate on my forehead! (yanking his ear) Look at me! -- Smile! -- Bigger! Breathe. ~ (she punches him) Breathe! (he does, Kate recoiling--) Ugh! -- Just don’t breathe on me. In the BG, THE CROWD REACTS to the SPINDLER-NYMAN scores.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Look, it goes away -- the worst I ever was, I went out and scored six goals in the first two periods.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (QVER)
dialogues.text: (booming through the building) KATHERINE MOSELEY AND DOUG DORSEY.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What are you saying, as soon as we get. out there you’re gonna be fine?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: It always just took me about ten minutes to relax. 33

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Our program is two and half minutes! DOUG forces a smile. Takes her hand.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: So eight minutes after we’re done I’ll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: CENTER ICE
dialogues.text: KATE AND DOUG first position. MUSIC SWELLS -=- something explosive and bold -- and they begin to skate. And we've never really seen them in action, and we’re not going to much of this, but what we do see is impressive before --

dialogues.speaker: THE CAMERA SWINGS TO FIND --
dialogues.text: ANTON -- watching from the sidelines nervously. THE JUDGES -- scoring, faces impossible to read. JACK -- in the stands, beaming. They must be doing good.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOJO and SCOTT wrapping up the night. ScoTT What a night for skating!

dialogues.speaker: JOJO
dialogues.text: And the headline in New Orleans tonight is Kate Mosely returning to the Nationals with a new partner, ex-hockey player Doug Dorsey. scoTr _I/11 admit it, Jojo, when I heard about this couple I thought they had to be kidding, but Doug Dorsey -- Wow! I guess you’d have to say he’s the Bo Jackson of the skating world. There’s a lot of shocked people in this town tonight. oe . CUT To: INT. HOTEL CORRIDOR -- NIGHT . DOUG, ANTON and KATE exiting the ELEVATOR, skate bags ove their shoulders. THEY’RE LAUGHING, basking in the moment victory, wandering up the hallway as WE HEAR OVER:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Brian Neuman and Lorie Paulsen, no surprises there, take the number one spot. John and Jody Weiderman skate a very safe but proficient number two and Kate Mosely and Doug Dorsey come out of nowhere to grab the three spot. Amid "goodnights," ANTON breaks off -- his room in the ne wing. KATE and DOUG continue on, still laughing as:

dialogues.speaker: SCOTT, (OVER)
dialogues.text: But three into to two won’t go, and two couples is all the U.S. will be sending to the Olympics this year.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO, (OVER)
dialogues.text: Tomorrow afternoon’s long program should be very exciting. V.O. FADES OUT -- KATE slows as they near her room.

dialogues.speaker: ' KATE
dialogues.text: ..if they were giving french fries instead of trophies, then you’d see her air it out. DOUG laughs. KATE stops at her door.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: See you tomorrow? ; * pouc I might be free. KATE shakes her head, finds her key. DOUG backing away.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hey, Kate... (she turns) Thanks for getting me through it. KATE blinks. DOUG turns, walking away. She watches him go DISSOLVE To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GROUPS OF SKATERS, COACHES and FAMILIES gathered outside waiting for-transportation. DOUG stands alone to one side

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Good morning. He turns -- LORIE PAULSEN behind him. DOUG smiles.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: What, are you doing tonight?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I hadn’t thought about it.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: Why don’t we meet after. (she smiles) We can compare bruises. On that, LORIE turns and walks away. DOUG watches her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LAP DISSOLVE A SERIES OF SCORES <= one to the next on the board, indicating the first three groups have skated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The LAST FOUR PAIRS warming up on the ice. THE WEIDERMAN TWINS. SPINDLER and NYMAN. FINALLY TO -- KATE AND DOUG -- taking it easy as BRIAN an LORIE come whipping past. KATE turns, eyes boring a hole through LORIE, as a LOUD BUZZER echoes through the buildi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE THE ICE -- Nothing for a moment -- JUST MUSIC, THE FINAL CHORUS OF SOMETHING GOOD AND BALLSY -- and then sud KATE and DOUG heave INTO FRAME -- AND NOW WE’RE RIGHT WIT THEM -- THE CAMERA sweeping along, no one’s ever shot ice skating like this before -- hand in hand, they speed acro the ice -- THE MUSIC PEAKING -- an arabesque -- looking r good -- into a lasso lift throw -- swooping to a blisteri stop -- THE ROUTINE IS OVER -- THE CROWD EXPLODES and --

dialogues.speaker: THE RUNWAY
dialogues.text: KATE, DOUG, and ANTON staring at the scoreboard as --
KATE stiffens. DOUG squints. ANTON looks displeased.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 87 CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOJO and SCOTT broadcasting.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO
dialogues.text: It’s hard to explain sometimes to people outside the sport, but scoring can really reflect more than what’s happening out on the ice. scoTT The judges have their favorites, and this evening I’m not sure if Kate and Doug fall into that category.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO"
dialogues.text: I thought that was a super program, but with the top two seeded pairs still to skate, it looks like Kate and Doug are headed for third place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG and KATE alone. He’s raging -- storming around the hallway, absolutely furious. KATE looks ready to ery.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: -- This is horseshit! What kind of crap are they trying to pull? -- We skated our asses off out there! KATE bites her lip, watching him rail around the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (wildly) : i ! -- I mean, am I crazy or did we just nail that goddamned program to the wall? He’s scaring her, she’s never seen him like this. SEVERAL PASSERSBY glance over nervously.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Doug, please...It’s not over yet.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (turning on her) Bullshit! -- We could’ve raised the roof off this building and they wouldn’t’ve placed us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 83 ‘THE ICE -- LATER BRIAN AND LORIE skating to BIZET’S CARMEN. They look good A big move -- they're really selling it and -- a WIPE TO: THE SCOREBOARD . Flashing numbers -- 5.9, 5.9, 6.0, 5.8, 5.9, 5.9, 5.8.

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: POLKA MUSIC fills the arena -- and here come the WEIDERMA TWINS, replete with leiderhosen and surreal smiles. Fancy toe-work across the ice -- and then he lifts her and they and -- SHE FALLS -- bad -- real bad -- THE CROWD GASPS -- cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE brushing at tears. DOUG silently steaming, as the SOUND OF THE CROWD’S GASP overwhelms the POLKA MUSIC. KATE looks up to see -- ANTON sprinting from the runway, rushing toward them --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Doug...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (turning) What?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: We gid it! OTHER SKATERS AND COACHES look: on as ANTON pulls KATE an DOUG into an ecstatic embrace. KATE transformed instantly bouncing around -- DOUG HOWLING -- KATE YELLING -- As THE celebrate, a SKATING OFFICIAL moves toward them.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Excuse me? -- Excuse me? (they turn, all smiles) We need to see the skaters alone. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SIGN READING -- USFSA DRUG TESTING PROGRAM hangs from t wall. KATE, holding an empty plastic cup, stares balefull at A WOMAN OFFICIAL.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: You’ll have to give me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I’m just sort of worked up. The WOMAN moves to a cooler. Opens it. KATE looks in.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: I have Coke, Sprite, Gatorade...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Is that a beer in there? The WOMAN pulls a Budweiser, hands it over. KATE pops the top, braces, and takes a sip. She smiles. She likes it.

dialogues.speaker: CENTER ICE
dialogues.text: Awards ceremony. TRIUMPHANT MUSIC booms through the arena as the top three pairs wave to the crowd. BRIAN AND LORIE standing on the top step. KATE AND DOUG right below in second. THE WEIDERMAN TWINS, looking grim, in third. DOUG looks stunned. KATE is beaming, blowing kisses to th house. THE CROWD ROARING. She turns for a different angle and loses her footing -- almost slipping off the platform

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (catching her) You all right?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m wonderful! (she’s tipsy) And you’re wonderful too! . DOUG can’t believe what he’s just heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIRTY REPORTERS crowded in this tight space. KATE and DOUG beside BRIAN and LORIE at a table answering question

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Doug, what’s the difference between this and hockey?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: The women. THE REPORTERS ROAR. KATE sneaks a sip from another beer.

dialogues.speaker: . REPORTER
dialogues.text: Kate, what’s it like skating with this guy?

dialogues.speaker: _ KATE
dialogues.text: Doug? Doug is the best. He’s just the best! . DOUG looks over. She’s not tipsy, she’s drunk. Beyond her, LORIE is watching, measuring DOUG’s reaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crush of PEOPLE: WELL-WISHERS, REPORTERS, SKATERS, COAC ETC. Flowers everywhere. JACK AND ANTON splipping through the CROWD, pass RICK TUTTLE giving an interview. JACK sto taps the REPORTER on the shoulder. He turns --

dialogues.speaker: TUTTLE
dialogues.text: (weakly) Jack, Anton, congratulations.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: (to the Reporter) This shark ever tries to deke me again, I'll give you a ‘story you’a kill for. TUTTLE pales. JACK and ANTON press on.

dialogues.speaker: THE FAR END OF THE HALLWAY -
dialogues.text: Away from the crowd, KATE and DOUG alone in street clothe

dialogues.speaker: _ DOUG
dialogues.text: We can’t just run out.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Of course we can! Come on... DOUG, unsure, glances back up the hallway to see LORIE an BRIAN surrounded by a CROWD OF WELL WISHERS.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (grabbing his hand) It’s our night. We can do whatever we want!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (confused) What’s going on here? I mean --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: -- I thought you were the one who wanted to cut loose... (she smiles) You’re coming with me and that’s all there is to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 91 : CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights shimmering in the moonlight. MUSIC UP -- we’re going into a MONTAGE here, a series of quick shots. -- A CAB stops in the heart of the French Quarter. KATE jumps out, ready to party. DOUG struggles to catch up. -- A CLUB ON BOURBON ST. Packed and hopping. KATE at the crowded bar, waving wildly for the BARTENDER. DOUG standi behind her, looking off-stride. -- CLUB #2. Wilder still. A ZYDECO BAND on stage, PATRONS DANCING and DRINKING. KATE and DOUG at a table. She finis the final sip of some tropical concoction. DOUG nursing a beer. KATE looks up, flags a passing WAITRESS. The WAITRE signals for another round. DOUG tries to wave her off, bu too late. ~-- CLUB #3. This place is really rocking. A BLUES BAND ON STAGE. The CROWD going nuts. DOUG watches KATE with disbelief -- she’s got her hair down, sweater off, chuggi yet another cocktail. Suddenly, she turns, takes his hand before he knows what’s happening she’s leading him out on the crowded dance floor. She’s a wild woman. DOUG can’t resist any longer -- they’re dancing. DISSOLVE. To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL -- KATE wrapped around DOUG in an empassioned embr At least it’s passionate from her standpoint, DOUG yuits away -- catches his breath. \

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: We’re here. KATE looks up. .She’s bombed. DOUG leads her out.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: THE DOOR TO KATE’S HOTEL ROOM -- MOMENTS LATER DOUG turns the key, opens the door, and stands aside.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Go on. KATE, leaning on him, looks up, focuses.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Aren’t you joining me?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Kate...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (sing-song blithering) ...Of course you are, you are, you are... She takes his hand, stumbling forward, pulling him into -

dialogues.speaker: HER HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: DOUG extracts his hand. KATE turns clumsily.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Aren’t you going to ask me te dance?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I don’t think so.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Oh, Doug...Douglas, silly thing, please, please don’t talk about thinking. That’s what I love about the way I feel right now. I feel — like even if I tried I couldn’t think and I’ve been thinking so much for so long and it’s sooococoe tiring... (she giggles) ...the world is spinning and spinning and spinning and I couldn’t care less... DOUG stands there. KATE begins to unbutton her blouse. KATE. -+-I/m looking at you and I’m seeing how you must’ve been as a little boy... (eyes weaving) .-.Hockey shirt hanging out. Bandaids on your knees... Her fingers fumble with the buttons. She’s really gone.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Did you ever play with magnets when you were little? -- Of course you did, everyone did. You know how you’d turn them one way and they’d push away? You’d run them around the table, pushing then, and then all you had to do was just flip them over and suddenly... (she smiles) ...don’t you see, that’s why everything’s been so awful... (the last button) ..-we just needed a little flip.  93

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Not tonight, Kate. Not like this. She stands there. Her expression darkens.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Not like what? Not like me?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: That’s not it. Kate, you’re bombed.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (trying to focus) What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You ought to sit down. Drink a lot of water. Try and get some --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (exploding) Oh God, just what I need -- somebody else telling me what to do! (she steps back, nearly falling) In case.you missed it, I’m throwing myself at you! (pulling her blouse around her) I’m standing here tearing off ny clothes and you’re giving me a rundown of drinking do’s and don’t’s!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe I know a little bit more about it than you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I get enough coaching on the ice! DOUG stiffens. He stands there, lost for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Get out. DouG You’ve got this all wrong.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Do I ever! (bitterly) Excuse my surprise, but really... how disappointing -- God’s gift to reckless abandon revealed as nothing but a prude in wolf’s clothing!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: What the hell does that mean?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It means I’m sick to death of your hormone-rattling sermons about the raptures of free-spirited behavior! She’s woosy, barely able to get this out and stay standin DOUG colors, stiffly trying to contain his anger.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You’re a lousy drunk.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: And you’re a lousy date.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: It didn’t have to be like this.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I said: Get out. DOUG turns, walking quickly back through the door -- and gone. KATE drops onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. DOUG’S HOTEL ROOM -- LATER FOUR EMPTY MINI-BAR BOTTLES OF VODKA are lined up in a ro DOUG, shirt off, sits in the half darkness, staring out t window. He’s drinking, putting on the buzz he refrained { all night. He’s moved past the stage of trying to make se of the past twenty-four hours, now just drinking to put himself to sleep. A KNOCK AT THE DOOR. DOUG comes to. . He shakes his head, crosses the room.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (opening the door) Kate, I really -- LORIE PAULSEN stands there, dressed to kill, holding seve bouquets of flowers. She peeks inside.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: You alone? . (Doug stands there, . speechless) You like roses? DOUG makes no move to take them. LORIE slides in past nia shutting the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: That’s one thing about skating, the fucking flowers can drive you crazy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ; DouG Lorie, listen... She slinks into the room, looking it over. LORIE ’ I waited for you. I guess we got our wires crossed.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: (looking for a place for the roses) Must be nice for Kate, skating with a man who doesn’t keep a vase around. LORIE turns. She looks incredible.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: I watched your program. You’ve got a great sit spin. (she smiles) I thought maybe we could trade secrets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun just cresting the horizon. curt To: INT. KATE’S HOTEL ROOM ~~ ‘DAWN KATE asleep on the bed, fully clothed, just as we left he She rustles. Her eyes blink open painfully. And then, the sledgehammer throb of her first, epic, hangover. She groa And then her expression dissolves from pain to panic, as previous night’s events begin to leak back in.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: KATE stands weakly before at a HOTEL ROOM DOOR. She stead herself, battling the pounding agony of her hangover. makes a half-hearted effort to pull herself together, wor her hair, rubbing her eyes, trying her injured best to lo She presentable. She summons a smile, and KNOCKS ON THE DOOR. A pause. And then the door opens. LORIE PAULSEN, holding only a pillow over her naked body, stands in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I...I must have the wrong roon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I’d say so. KATE starts to back away. LORIE standing there, when -- DOUG’S VOICE (groggily, from inside) What the hell’s going on? KATE freezes.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: (to Kate) A little early for practice, isn’t it? DOUG, in the BG, pulls a sheet around him, coming for the door -- no idea what’s happening -- moving sleepily behin LORIE -- and then his jaw drops -- his eyes meet KATE’s. She turns -- bolting down the hallway --

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: oh shit... DOUG pushes past LORIE, rushing out into the hall, nearly colliding with SEVERAL HOTEL GUESTS exiting the next roon

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: -- Kate! Wait a minute...! Kate, come on, just --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (wheeling on him) -- You pig! You complete, total, unreedemable pig! (he stops cold) How? -- How could you? My God, to think I was coming to apologize and and all the while you were in there with her!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Kate, that’s not -- KATE . -- Don’t! Don’t even try! Don’t you dare say one more word! (Doug stands there) My God, just looking at you makes me sick! She turns away. The HOTEL GUESTS look on, shocked. SEVERAL OTHER DOORS pop open -=- more curious FACES.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (suddenly) Wait one fucking minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96  97 DOUG charges after her, the sheet flapping round him as h grabs for her -- KATE yanks herself free --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: -- Get your hands off me! KATE strides for her door. DOUG struggling after.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Maybe I missed something along the way, but I don’t remember making promises to you about anything.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (pure disgust) -- my God... DOUG jumps between her and her room. MORE GUESTS peer out from doorways up and down the HALLWAY.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: One question -- one -- Were you, or were you not, engaged to be married until the day before yesterday?

dialogues.speaker: KATE" /
dialogues.text: That is hardly the point!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Maybe you’d rather replay the moment you bounced me out of your room.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Count your blessings -- she might not have waited much longer.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: That’s not how it happened.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: ‘You can spare me the details!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Fine! -- Then let me just hit the highlights: For fifteen months you act like I’m a cross between a trained dog and your worst nightmare. And then -- in the space of three hours -- I’m supposed to be falling at your feet, thanking ny lucky stars because you’ve just gotten drunk enough to decide I’m worthy of your attention. Well, excuse me, I’m really fucking sorry, but I can’t downshift that fast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 98 KATE pulls her key. Stares at him grimly. . KATE . Get out of my way. DOUG moves aside. KATE jams her key into the lock.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: That’s all you have to say?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No. No, I have one more thing to add: From now on, from this minute until we finally, mercifully, go our separate ways, our relationship is strictly business. KATE ploughs into her room. The DOOR SLAMS SHUT. DOUG standing there, turns to see a DOZEN HOTEL GUESTS staring at hin. pouG : What the hell are you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE and DOUG taking off their skates. ANTON holding a stack of papers. The vibe is deadly. Past hostile. They direct all comments to ANTON: . KATE . Tell him he snaps my hand back on. that Salchow one more time it’s ~ going to take a week to count the pick marks up his back.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Tell her, she doesn’t put a little high test into that twist-lift it’s gonna take a month to soak the black and blue outta her landing gear. ANTON ignores this. Pulls a bench in front of then. Places something on the bench for their inspection.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Deffel and Frick. German. INSERT -- A. PHOTOGRAPH -- the first of a series -- WE’LL INTERCUT PICTURES AS NEEDED with ANTON’S COMMENTARY and KATE and DOUG’s reactions.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Height. Power. A triple outside Salchow. Much injuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oO ANTON turns the next picture.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Hastings and Mulgrew. Canadian National Champions. Big energy. But sloppy. (the next) Dubois and Gercel. French. Triple toe loop. Lutz twist. (the next) Neuman and Paulsen... (pointedly) +..we know their work. (the .next) Greka and Turgeyev. Russian. Gold medal Calgary. Two time world champions. And then three pictures in a row. KATE, bored until now - KATE shifts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Izuto and Tenaki.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Never heard of them.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Will be crushing news to them I am sure. Last night they win NHK Championships. One hand lasso lift into double Axel throw. Forward outside death spiral. Triple Salchow. Triple Axel twist.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Whoaa...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Izuto and Tenaki?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Japanese government enjoys surprise too. They are who we must beat. (he measures them) For gold, we must have slingshot triple. We start again tomorrow. DOUG starts putting his skates back on.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What are you doing? 99

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (to Anton) Tell her, I’ve got another hour left in me. If she’s up to it.

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: KATE and DOUG, both wearing pads and helmets, working on the slingshot triple -- KATE speeding for the launch -- DOUG turns -- mis-steps -- they both fall --

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: Trying it again -- KATE in the air -- turning -- descendi -- falling past DOUG’s waiting arms -- landing on the ice

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: And again -- picking up speed -- rounding the turn -- int his arms -- just missing -- KATE landing hard --

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (barking from the sidelines) We ! Is not power play, Douglas! And Katya, what is bullshit with free leg, eh? When I say to swing wide, am I speaking to myself? KATE and DOUG glower from the ice. Tempers tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Center ice -- Again! JACK enters to join ANTON on the sidelines as KATE and DO trudge back to center ice in the BG. The two men lean the a moment, watching KATE and DOUG wrangle into position, a then ANTON turns to JACK:

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I need to know, what do we skate for, Jack? Medal or Gold?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You mean this new triple? You’re asking me? ANTON nods. A beat. JACK thinks a moment.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Let’s put it like this: in thirt years, can you remember how many second places you won?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (eyes on the ice) I just wanted to make sure.

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: A CLOSE ANGLE -- DOUG and KATE, no pads this time, flying across the ice -- very fast -- hand in hand -- now turnin -- into DOUG’s arms and he lifts and she’s up and -- SUPE SLO MOTION as -- KATE explodes:into the air -- the slings triple -- around -- and around -- and she’s losing it -- coming down -- too fast -- off balance -- grimacing -- an she hits the ice hard -- skidding away -- motionless and

dialogues.speaker: FLASH CUT
dialogues.text: INT. KATE’S BEDROOM -=- NIGHT SILENCE -- KATE bolts upright in bed. It was a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE, in robe and slippers, staring at the EMPTY TROPHY C

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Kate? KATE starts, turns. JACK is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I came down. I was looking at the pictures of mother.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: She would’ve been so proud of you.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Really? You think she’d look at me, at what I am -- you think she’d be proud? KATE stares at him. ‘JACK suddenly uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You better get back to bed.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I can’t sleep.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You’1l be better off upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s funny how you or someone else always know where I’1l be better off.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: What are we talking about, Kate?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I guess I’m just taking a moment to marvel at the determination of the people around me. It’s really quite something. Everyone has such clear, urgent ideas of where and when and how I should be. It’s almost dazzling to be at the center _ of so many intersecting agendas.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: You must be very tired. KATE stares down at the EMPTY TROPHY CASE on Jack’s desk.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I mean, look at this thing. Just sitting here, waiting... (turning to Jack) What if it just stays empty? What if there’s nothing to ever put in there?

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s late. We’re both tense. (gently) If you don’t want to go to bed it’s fine by me. No.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: No, I’m-going up... (she starts away) +-.These little victories can be so exhausting. JACK stands there, mouth open, as she leaves. cut TO: INT. DOUG’S APARTMENT -- NIGHT A clock reads 3:45.

dialogues.speaker: THE TV --
dialogues.text: striding across the good reason -- it’s DOUG slouched before the TV -- KATE AND BRIAN skating in competition, ice, and if this looks familiar there’s the broadcast of their Calgary disaster.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (QVER)
dialogues.text: Here comes the triple toe loop... KATE into BRIAN’s arms -- he’s liftng -- too fast --' he falters -- too late -- she’s launched -- into the air -- spinning -- around and around but -- trouble -- she’s off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 203 balance -- coming down -- BRIAN watching in horror -- KAT falling to the ice as the MUSIC crashes its final CRESCEN

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (OVER)
dialogues.text: Oh dear... DOUG sits there, watching, wondering, as the commentary CONTINUES (QVER) and we -- DISSOLVE To: EXT. A MOUNTAIN CHATEAU -- DAY. A sprawling estate. Snow-capped Alps. SUPERIMPOSE:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE, DOUG, ANTON and JACK standing there, looking around as SEVERAL MAIDS and VALETS bring in their luggage. cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VARIOUS QUICK SHOTS -- establishing the chaos, magnitude and excitement of the Winter Olympics in full swing: SKIE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous, new facility. SKATERS, COACHES, JUDGES and REPORTERS scattered around the ice, watching DOUG and KAT and HALF A DOZEN INTERNATIONAL PAIRS practice on the ice

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: KATE and DOUG out practicing with THREE OTHER PAIRS. KATE comes out of a turn nearly crashing into -- LORIE PAULSEN skating in with BRIAN out of nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: . BRIAN
dialogues.text: We missed you at the opening ceremonies.

dialogues.speaker: LORIE
dialogues.text: (to Kate) Trouble in paradise?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (wheeling on Lorie) Get the fuck away from my partner.  Heads turn. LORIE stiffens. BRIAN pulls her away.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (shocked) You didn’t have to do that.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Better late than never. A beat. KATE unsure what this means, about to ask, when something draws her attention off the ice. THEY BOTH TURN IN THE RUNWAY -- TWO YQUNG ASIAN SKATERS moving with a la ENTOURAGE OF HANDLERS and SECURITY PEOPLE toward the ice.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Izuto and Tenaki... IZUTO AND TENAKI laughing with their COACHES, real loose.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: God, they look so young.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: They’1l age a little when they see our slingshot triple.

dialogues.speaker: KATE-
dialogues.text: We’re not doing it. DOUG turns back. This is news. The BUZZER SOUNDS. . DouG What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m taking it off the progran. It’s too dangerous. Without another word, she skates away. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A baronial table looks empty with just KATE, DOUG, ANTON and JACK spread around it. RAISED VOICES ECHO through the chateau’s gothic hallways -- A heated argument in progres

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: -- I’d just like to know why I busted my nuts for five weeks on a move she never had any intention of trying!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: -- Douglas --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: -- Will you please remind him the number of possible point reductions we're talking about here!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Oh bullshit! -- You don’t want to win! You just want to get through this without dusting your precious ass!

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: Whe the hell do you think you’re talking to?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Stuff it, Jack! This is between us! JACK sits there, stunned. DOUG turns back to KATE.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Bronze, silver, honorable goddamned mention -- It doesn’t really make a aifference to you at all, does it? You’re a rich girl -- So what if you come up a little short, right?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: . Douglas -- stop! Silence. DOUG stands, stares at her across the table.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Just so you know: I’m working without anet here. Losing gracefully does shit for me! KATE, staggered, sits back, says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: It’s up to her. She doesn’t want to do it -- it’s out! DOUG turns to ANTON. No help here. DOUG walks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun glistening on the mountains. OLYMPIC MUSIC SWELLS and

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUES AS. WE --
dialogues.text: cur To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Skates being laced up, covers being pulled tight: PURPLE

dialogues.speaker: SKATES
dialogues.text: 106 FINALLY TO -- BLACK SKATES -- DOUG lacing up in the MEN’S LOCKER ROOM.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: THE LADIE’S LOCKER ROOM Buzzing with tension. KATE doing everything she can not to look over at LORIE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A packed house. SYNTHESIZED POP-ROCK BLARING. The CROWD watching HASTINGS AND MULGREW conclude their short progra

dialogues.speaker: IN THE RUNWAY
dialogues.text: waiting to go on next. DOUG, in familar, pre-skate pallor fingers his tunic.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (noting his shirt) You forgot a button.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: No, I want it like that. In the BG, HASTINGS AND MULGREW come off the ice.

dialogues.speaker: , _ KATE
dialogues.text: It looks like shit.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Kate, please...lighten up.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (instigating) It’s meant to be buttoned.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: It pulls at my neck.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Then you should’ve mentioned it three weeks ago. A FRENCH OLYMPIC OFFICIAL leans in, ushering them forward

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Prenez la piste... THE CROWD REACTS to the previous scores as KATE and DOUG pull off skate-guards, start down the runway and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 107 SKATE CAM CLOSE-UP -- as they take several wide warm-up. turns. Two big smiles, frozen in place,. belie whispered. barbs through clenched teeth that only WE CAN HEAR:

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m asking you for the last time. (Doug ignores her) Button the goddamned button.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Get over it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You are an immature asshole of the lowest order. That’s it. DOUG snaps. His grip tightening at her waist.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (still smiling) If it was forty below and that button meant the difference between a long, satisfying life and a horrible death by hypothermia, I still wouldn’t give you the fucking satisfaction. THE BUZZER GOES OFF =~ it’s showtime. . CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK FEED
dialogues.text: MUSIC PLAYING as KATE and DOUG move through the final pas _of ‘their short program -- skating well but mechanically anger, the distance between’ them is visible -- into a do split Lutz twist lift -- KATE in the air -- and down and hovering over her at center ice as the MUSIC CRASHES IT’S FINISH. They stand, bowing stiffly to the APPLAUSE, befor skating for the runway. PEGGY AND DICK -- the two NETWORK ANNOUNCERS, break in.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: Technically superior program, Peggy, but did you feel, as I did, that there was something missing?

dialogues.speaker: ' PEGGY
dialogues.text: Absolutely, Dick. They delivered all the short program required moves but it seemed cold -- more like we were watching two individual athletes than a fluid pair. They just didn’t look like they were having fun out there.

dialogues.speaker: DICK
dialogues.text: And here come the scores --

dialogues.speaker: A NETWORK INTERVIEW AREA
dialogues.text: just off the runway. DOROTHY HAMILL holds a microphone to KATE and DOUG as they tensely watch the scores above, we see them on the network GRAPHIC.

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (OVER)
dialogues.text: L‘ nombre des points technicale: 5.9, 5.8, 5.8, 5.7, 5.9, 5.8, 5.7, 5.8. (a beat} L’nombre des points artistique: 5.6, 5.7, 5.8, 5.6, 5.7, 5.6, 5.6, 5.7. Stiff smiles harden. DOROTHY leans in with the mike.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: Kate, it looked like you two were having trouble connecting out there. (she waits, Kate is silent) Did you feel like your energy might have been a little down? An awkward moment. KATE can’t find her tongue.

dialogues.speaker: DOROTHY
dialogues.text: (still probing Kate) Was the altitude a problem? KATE hesitates, too tight to talk. DOUG jumps in -- pous / The ice was lousy. We were off our game. Well be back tomorrow -- Okay? DOROTHY, thrown, stares over as DOUG pulls KATE OUT OF FR cut To:

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE -
dialogues.text: A -PROKOFIEV CLASSIC BOOMING through the house. IZUTO AND TENAKI skating -- a little clinical, but looking real goo two young phenoms tearing through their program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE, in street clothes, stands there lifelessly. ANTON, furious, stares over as DOUG, carrying his skate bag, loo very sour, strides toward then.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (disgusted) What a long way to be coming for such garbage skating.  109

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (in no mood) Look, I’1l see you later. I. gotta walk it off.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: No. Absolutely no. We go back. DouG I said, I’m going for a walk. ANTON steps forward, just about to really get into it whe

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Let him go! (they turn) If he’s smart, he’ll walk all the way back to Minnesota and forget this ever happened! (she looks wild) He didn’t screw up out there. He came to skate ~- just like he always does -- to skate and win and try to make something out of all this crap. (tears welling) It’s my fault. Me. I’m the one who screwed it up.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: (moving for her) Katya, please...

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Stop! Don’t-you dare try and baby me. I’m the one whd’s. responsible and I deserve to feel exactly as lousy as I do right now! (staring at Doug) I’m sorry. I’m very, very sorry. And now, before she starts to sob, she turns -- running as fast as she can away down the hall. ANTON following --

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Katya! -- Katya, wait! DOUG, staggered, stands there, watching them disappear, digesting what’s just occured. Finally, he takes a deep breath, muscles his skate bag over his shoulder, turns, and starts walking in the opposite direction --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG wandering alone through the crowd.  119

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U.S. HOCKEY TEAM scrimmaging in this otherwise empty facility. DOUG lingering in the shadows, watching.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0S)
dialogues.text: Can I help you? DOUG turns. AN ASSISTANT COACH stands there.

dialogues.speaker: ASST. COACH
dialogues.text: If you’re not part of the program, I’m.gonna have to ask you to leave. DOUG nods. Walks off. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE stands alone, staring out at the mountains. ANTON comes out through the doors. Crosses to her. Puts a coat over her shoulders. They stand there.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (almost to herself) We come around that far turn and we're picking up speed and we’re going so fast and I keep telling myself I should be concentrating on my free leg and my grip, but all I can think about is how much I don’t trust him. And then, the moment I’m in the air, all I can think about is how much I don’t trust myself. ’ ANTON (gently) Katya, Slingshot is out. Is done. We will skate New Orleans program . and’ it will be wonderful. . KATE says nothing. They stare out into the distance.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: I have decided these are the most beautiful mountains I have ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: I’m retiring after tomorrow. For real.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: Is not unexpected news.  liz

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: He'll find another partner. He’s good enough.

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: He will find no one like you. No matter what he does. KATE ponders this. A long pause.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Think he’1ll be back tonight?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: He‘ll make it. (she glances over, ‘ Anton smiles) I trust hin. KATE nods. Pulls the coat more tightly around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG, alone, wolfs down the last of his dinner. Alone in the crowd. He looks up to see A COUPLE at the next table, locked in a passionate kiss. He drains his beer. Stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DOUG enters. He drops his bag. The house is dark, quiet. He listens. And then wearily starts to climb the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. KATE’S CHATEAU BEDROOM -- NIGHT KATE, her Chicago Blackhawks jersey bundled around her, sitting awake in bed.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ‘INT. ‘DOUG’S CHATEAU BEDROOM -- NIGHT DOUG can’t sleep either. In a chair, staring out the wind DISSOLVE To: DOUG’S BEDROOM -- MORNING SUDDEN SUNLIGHT as ANTON pulls the curtains. DOUG asleep in the chair, rustles, eyes opening slowly: :

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: «.-Oh man...what time is it?

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: ‘Noon. TI let you sleep.  DouG (springing up) Noon? -- Jesus, Anton, they’re starting at one!

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: You missed the draw. We skate last. We have time.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Where’s Kate? -- How is she?

dialogues.speaker: . ANTON
dialogues.text: She’s fine. She and Jack left early. (all business) You wash up. We go together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing room only crowd. Tension you can taste. THE VOICES OF PEGGY AND DICK break over the picture:

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (QVER)
dialogues.text: Here they are, the final four pairs are warming up.* ON THE ICE -- LORIE-BRIAN, TURGEYEV-GREKA, IZUTO-TENAKI. PEGGY (OVER) . We've seen some lovely skating so far this afternoon, but I think it’s pretty safe to say that our medalists are all out on the ice right now. FINALLY TO -- KATE AND DOUG skating through a lift sectio practicing silently. Skating on eggshells.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (QVER)
dialogues.text: Yes, this is the cream. And in the next half hour, we’ll be watching ‘one of these pairs rise to the top. THE BUZZER SOUNDS -- THE SKATERS wrap up the practice.

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: SHOSTAKOVITCH booming. TURGEYEV AND GREKA on the ice --

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (OVER)
dialogues.text: ...a little sloppy on that arabesque ...and here comes the double Axel... GREKA leaves the ice -- TURGEYEV lifting her -- she arche TURGEYEV’s arms falters just slightly and --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 113 ” CUT TO:

dialogues.text: DOUG breathing. KATE stretching. Nobody talking, as the SHOSTAKOVITCH crescendoes to a CLOSE. THE CROWD APPLAUDIN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIFTEEN TV MONITORS going -- all various angles of BRIAN AND LORIE skating to “ANYTHING GOES" AS A TV CREW OF EIGH PEOPLE, crammed into this tight. space, work and CHATTER

dialogues.speaker: DIRECTOR
dialogues.text: (calling shots) Okay...Camera three -- Get a little wider, Eddie -- Wider! (continuing as--) ON THE MONITORS -- BRIAN AND LORIE skate some fancy toe-w side-by-side, and into a death spiral --

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY, (OVER)
dialogues.text: Beautiful extension, but they’re not going for the forward inside here. The difficulty factor on this is low.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (QVER)
dialogues.text: It’s a safe program, but they’re executing very nicely... cUuT TO:

dialogues.text: OLYMPIC OFFICIALS and TV CREWS choking the sightlines as BRIAN and -LORIE move through the end of their program. RICK TUTTLE nervous, totally focused on his skaters. ANTON, KATE and DOUG at the rear of the runway peering ou KATE and ANTON watching the skating as "ANYTHING GOES* blares to its CONCLUSION and THE CROWD ROARS its approval

dialogues.speaker: THE NETWORK FEED
dialogues.text: BRIAN and LORIE standing with TUTTLE and DOROTHY HAMILL in the INTERVIEW AREA as their scores flash on the screen

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (OVER)
dialogues.text: L’nombre de points technical: 5.8, 5.7, 5.8, 5.7, 5.7, 5.8, 5.7, 5.8. (beat) L’nombre de points artistique: 5.9, 5.9, 5.8, 5.9, 6.0, 5.8, 5.9, 5.8.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big smiles. TUTTLE hugs his skaters.

dialogues.speaker: PEGGY, (QVER)
dialogues.text: Great scores! Neuman and Paulsen, looking well positioned for a medal.

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (QVER)
dialogues.text: Yes Peggy, but I’m not sure it will be gold. They might’ve played it just a little safe. Still to skate are Izuto and Tenaki and Kate Moseley and Doug Dorsey.

dialogues.speaker: THE RUNWAY
dialogues.text: KATE and DOUG stand quietly with ANTON as THE OPENING NOTES OF "PEER GYNT" begin in the BG..

dialogues.speaker: . ANTON
dialogues.text: (hypnotically) A flame...the fire, the purity of flame is burning away imperfection. All mistakes. All difficulty. Ail effort. Everything is burned away except ice and skates. Everything falls away except perfection. (he pauses) . I go now. I find a seat. I watch the famous Japanese. Come... (he pulls them into his embrace) You are my champions. I am proud. (he pulls back) Enjoy. -KATE and DOUG watch as ANTON walks off through the runwa

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK FEED
dialogues.text: IZUTO and TENAKI captured by the TV CAMERAS. Skating grea a double AXEL throw, she lands perfectly --

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (QVER)
dialogues.text: -- Lovely! -- and here’s the layback ».ea little clinical but right on the money... eo CUT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE RUNWAY
dialogues.text: KATE AND DOUG stretching beside the NETWORK INTERVIEW ARE In the BG, IZUTO and TENAKI spin at CENTER ICE, as the MU CRASHES TO A CLOSE. THE CROWD ROARS its approval. KATE lo up to see DOUG staring at her --  115

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: You okay? KATE nods tightly.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I guess. They hesitate. A silent moment. Neither of them quite abl to find the words. As suddenly -- IZUTO AND TENAKI -~ five yards away -- come sweeping off ice, into the arms of their ENTOURAGE. Hugs and kisses an LOTS OF JAPANESE CONGRATULATIONS and NETWORK PRODUCTION P trying to get the couple over to DOROTHY HAMILL in the INTERVIEW BOOTH. And judging by the activity and reaction this event is over. KATE frozen, watching all this. She turns to find -- DOUG still staring at her, the rest of the world lost for

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: I can’t stand this anymore. KATE . Doug, we have to skate...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: This won’t wait four and half minutes. (in a rush) Kate, look, maybe I’m a jerk. Maybe I wasn’t ready. Maybe I was afraid. I don’t know. I just have this terrible feeling that after today I’m not gonna see you again and... I don’t care about the skating, I just.don/t.want it to end for us. KATE stares. Both of them terrified by what’s just been s

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Doug...no...we’re not right for each other -- We’re not.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Yes we are! I’m right for you. I know it. I fee) it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (weakly) It would never work.  116

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: It already has! -- We’ve just been so goddamned wrapped up in the rest of this stuff that we couldn’t see it.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: It’s too complicated.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: There’s nothing complicated about it. (he steps closer) Kate, I never met anybody like you before. It took me a long time to get used to it but now... (he smiles) Who else is gonna put up with your shit? KATE, reeling, as THE CROWD AROUND THEM COMES ALIVE -- TH

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH ANNOUNCER BEGINS READING THE SCORES, (QVER)
dialogues.text: KATE AND DOUG stand there -- suddenly aware of the situat

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (turning back) We’re doing the triple.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: You heard me. ” pous No. No way. A hovering OLYMPIC OFFICIAL leans in --

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: You may take the ice please.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (ignoring this) I thought you wanted to win. I know you do. I’m the one who put us in this hole, and I say it’s the triple.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Kate, look, forget about it. We’re doing the double, I’m not having you fall.

dialogues.speaker: MOSELEY AND DORSEY.
dialogues.text: A FRENCH OFFICIAL steps forward, pushing them toward the

dialogues.speaker: . FRENCH OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: S’il vous plais -- Allez y...

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (turning on him) Lay off a minute, willya! The OFFICIAL steps back, shocked. OTHERS in the runway begin to take notice as KATE starts for the ice --

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: -- Look at me! (grabbing her back) The last thing I want to do is start running your life.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: So we’re agreed. Triple.

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: No! -- It’s not worth it. You don’t have to do this for me.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (with a smile) I’ve fallen before. It’s not the end of the world --

dialogues.speaker: -- MOSELEY AND DORSEY --
dialogues.text: DouG -- Kate, listen, please -- ANOTHER FRENCH OFFICIAL rushes into the fray.

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: -- Vous avez trente seconds -- Seconds -- pour monter ‘sur la glace!

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: (to Official #3) -- Shut the hell up for a minute! It’s getting chaotic -- KATE looks around, FACES everywhe

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Kate --

dialogues.speaker: ANNOUNCER, (OVER)
dialogues.text: -- Patineurs! S’il vous plais! Before DOUG can say another word, KATE takes his hand, pulling him down the runway, kicking off her skate guards

dialogues.speaker: OFFICIAL
dialogues.text: Fifteen seconds! TWO OLYMPIC OFFICIALS drop to their knees, whipping off DOUG’s guards as he staggers forward in KATE’s grip and -

dialogues.speaker: ONTO THE ICE
dialogues.text: KATE AND DOUG instinctively manufacturing smiles as they glide toward their opening position, whispering as they g

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Double.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: Triple. They stop at CENTER ICE. Stiffly srike their opening pose

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: Double. THE CROWD GOES QUIET. DOUG and KATE, side-by-side.

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: What difference does it make?

dialogues.speaker: DOUG
dialogues.text: The difference is I love you. She turns -- total, utter, heart-stopping shock. And then she smiles ---a big, confident smile. ” KATE Then how could we possibly miss? " DOUG can’t argue, because THE MUSIC STARTS POUNDING and it sounds familiar, that’s because this is The Song and - THEY’RE OFF and we’ve seen competition skating before, but never nore than thirty seconds, and never, never, anything like this around the ice -- Killian position -- accelerating into a wicked camel spin -- and out, and they look terrific and

dialogues.speaker: NETWORK FEED
dialogues.text: Toe work across the ice -- perfect -- power -- intensity focus -- elegance -- and they’re smiling for real -- comp eye-contact -- lost in themselves as --

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (QVER)
dialogues.text: Wow! What a difference a day makes. This is hot!

dialogues.speaker: LIVE ACTION
dialogues.text: DOUG lowers KATE into a death spiral -- her pony-tail jus brushing the ice -- around and around and then, as if she were weightless, he’s lifting -- pulling her to him as if his very life depended on it and --

dialogues.speaker: ANTON
dialogues.text: mouth open, not believing what he’s seeing and --

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: DOUG easing KATE off her skates -- above him -- a platter lift -- she arches in the air -- DOUG turning and --

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: MARTIN’S ROOM -- MANSION <- CONNECTICUT MARTIN huddled on his couch, amid popcorn and cookies, watching TV. Grinning from ear to ear.

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE .
dialogues.text: KATE and DOUG side-by-side mirror movements -~ everything instinctive -- MUSIC BUILDING -- staring at each other -- devouring each other with their eyes and -- cUuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: THE JUDGES
dialogues.text: looking on in amazement and --

dialogues.speaker: TUTTLE
dialogues.text: standing with LORIE and BRIAN, he can’t help himself, he breaks a smile -- this is something truly special --

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: a double Lutz washing into a serpentine cross step and -- cuT TO:

dialogues.speaker: JACK
dialogues.text: in the stands, not yet daring to believe his eyes and --

dialogues.text: Cameras sweeping to keep up as KATE and DOUG whip through a cross chasse, rounding the end of the rink and --

dialogues.text: _There’s steam coming off the ice!

dialogues.speaker: DICK, (QVER)
dialogues.text: Here comes the double... cuT To:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATE and DOUG, rounding the rink -- about to break --

dialogues.speaker: KATE
dialogues.text: (under her breath) Triple! Triple! -~ and they separate -- picking up speed -- into DOUG’s arms -- and she’s up and exploding into -- SLO-MOTION -- -- KATE in the air -- soaring -- around....and around....and around...and landing like a feather! -- Perfectly into DOUG’s waiting arms and --

dialogues.speaker: THE CROWD
dialogues.text: blown away. Witnessing history and they know it. CUT To:

dialogues.speaker: THE NETWORK CAMERA TRAILER
dialogues.text: Dead silence. The DIRECTOR and EVERYONE ELSE just staring at the monitors.

dialogues.speaker: IZUTO AND TENAKI
dialogues.text: into it, moving to the beat as the MUSIC CRANKS -- OUT OF THE BRIDGE -~ INTO THE FINAL CHORUS and -- cuT To:

dialogues.speaker: THE ICE
dialogues.text: KATE and DOUG on some other plane of existence -- hand in hand -- lost in each other’s eyes -- a moment -- and then she’s rising into a one~hand lasso lift -- and forget abo any more cutaways, this is all KATE and DOUG -- she’s up. they’re moving -- DOUG’s arm like a steel rod, no hesitat

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 122 and THE MUSIC PEAKS and he pushes and KATE is up -- and turning -- and coming down -- and down -- and at the last possible second, DOUG sweeps in to catch her and it’s all perfect -- the final push toward center ice -- accelerati -- faster -- MUSIC CLIMAXING and finally -- A SIDE-BY-SID BLUR SPIN at center ice -- right in the JUDGE’S FACES -- two crazy tops drilling down and down and they fall into other’s arms as THE MUSIC ENDS and -- - THE CROWD -- on its feet -- THIRTY THOUSAND PEOPLE GOING NUTS and -- JACK screaming and carrying on like a teenage girl and -- TUTTLE, LORIE, and BRIAN <- cheering right along and -- IZUTO AND TENAKI --. shaking their heads and -- THE JUDGES -- hearing the CROWD and -- ANTON -- smiling, exhausted, wiping away tears and -- THE ICE -- littered with flowers, and they’re still comin bouquets raining down from everywhere and --

dialogues.speaker: FINALLY TO --
dialogues.text: KATE AND DOUG -~ completely oblivious to everything, all over each other, locked in a passionate, all-consuming, never-let-you-go kiss that just goes on and on and...

dialogues.speaker: THE TROPHY CASE .
dialogues.text: except now it’s been enlarged and it’s no longer empty -- TWO GOLD MEDALS side by side and --

dialogues.speaker: ICE
dialogues.text: A reprise of the opening scene. The two, lovely, innocent SIX-YEAR-OLD CHILDREN we watched skate so touchingly befo Except now they’re not skating, they’re FIGHTING -- argui crying, finger pointing -- a furious clash of wills that grows more heated, AS WE --
